answer is C

questions.question_text:
An organization wants to implement a SIEM deployment architecture. However, they have the capability to do only log collection and the rest of the SIEM functions must be managed by an MSSP.
Which SIEM deployment architecture will the organization adopt?

discussion.content: The answer is B according to the official courseware: Module 5 page 609.

Based on the provided information, Banter is currently at the Processing and Exploitation stage of the threat intelligence life cycle.

The Processing and Exploitation stage involves formatting and structuring the raw data collected during the Collection stage. This stage typically involves data cleaning, normalization, and transformation, and may also involve data enrichment and correlation with other sources of data. The output of this stage is typically a set of structured data that is ready for analysis in the next stage.

questions.question_text:
Banter is a threat analyst in Christine Group of Industries. As a part of the job, he is currently formatting and structuring the raw data.
He is at which stage of the threat intelligence life cycle?

discussion.content:
popocloud is correct.
Answer is A.
Check the Student manual, page 687.

The answer is A
Module 6 pg 687

D-
This sequence ensures that you first plan and allocate the necessary resources, then consider the lab's physical requirements, obtain any required licenses, set up the work areas, hire personnel, and finally establish physical security measures.

choices.A: Planning and budgeting –> Physical location and structural design considerations –> Work area considerations –> Human resource considerations –> Physical security recommendations –> Forensics lab licensing
choices.D: Planning and budgeting –> Physical location and structural design considerations –> Forensics lab licensing –>Work area considerations –> Human resource considerations –> Physical security recommendations
choices.B: Planning and budgeting –> Physical location and structural design considerations–> Forensics lab licensing –> Human resource considerations –> Work area considerations –> Physical security recommendations
choices.C: Planning and budgeting –> Forensics lab licensing –> Physical location and structural design considerations –> Work area considerations –> Physical security recommendations –> Human resource considerations
